summary: Radioactive materials are commonly used for things like treating cancer and sterilizing medical instruments. But even a small amount could be used in a dirty bomb, which uses conventional explosives to spread radioactive material. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission issues licenses to people and organizations that need to possess radioactive material. However, our investigators used shell companies and fraudulent licenses to purchase radioactive materials from 2...
title: Preventing a Dirty Bomb: Vulnerabilities Persist in NRC's Controls for Purchases of High-Risk Radioactive Materials
